revised_title: Isolation and Properties of Turacine, a Copper-Containing Pigment in Birds
tldr: A. W. Church investigates a red pigment called turacine found in the feathers of four species of Touraco birds. Turacine contains 59% copper, which cannot be removed without destroying the pigment. The author proposes the name turacine for this unique pigment and compares its properties to scarlet cruorine.
